Variables

support-legacy 

$support-legacy: true !global;

Description

Defines whether the lib should support legacy browsers (e.g. IE 8).

Type

Bool

Since

0.3.9

TODO's

  • Nothing. It's awesome.

[Deprecated] i 

$i: 0 !global;

Description

Defines the number of iteration.

Type

Number

map 

$map: ("a": "b", "c": "" );

Description

Test map

Type

Map

Parameters

None.

Returns

List

Example

 sl-comma-list()
 // ()

sl-chunk 

@function sl-chunk ($list, $size) { ... }

Description

Chunks $list into $size large lists.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to chunk

 List —
$size

length of lists

 Number —

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-chunk(a b c d e, 2)
 // a b, c d, e

Throws

  • $size is not a number for sl-chunk.

Requires

  • sl-to-list

sl-contain 

@function sl-contain ($list, $value) { ... }

Description

Returns whether $list contains $value.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to check

 List —
$value

value to look for

 Any —

Returns

Bool

Example

 sl-contain(a b c, a)
 // true

 sl-contain(a b c, z)
 // false

Used by

  • sl-include

sl-count-values 

@function sl-count-values ($list) { ... }

Description

Counts the number of occurrences of each value of $list.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to count values from

 List —

Returns

Values mapped to their count

Map

Example

 sl-count-values(a b c a)
 // (a: 2, b: 1, c: 1)

sl-every 

@function sl-every ($list, $function, $args...) { ... }

Description

Tests whether all items from $list pass the test implemented by $function.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to run test against

 List —
$function

function to run against every item from list

 String —
$args

extra arguments to pass to the function

 Arglist —

Returns

Bool

Example

 sl-every(1 2 3, unitless)
 // true

 sl-every(1 2 3px, unitless)
 // false

Used by

  • sl-sum

sl-explode 

@function sl-explode ($string, $delimiter: '', $separator: 'space') { ... }

Description

Explodes $string into a list using $delimiter as a delimiter.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$string

string to explode

 String —
$delimiter

string to use as a delimiter

 String ''
$separator

list separator

 String 'space'

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-explode(abc)
 // a b c

 sl-explode(abc, b)
 // a c

Throws

  • $string is not a string for sl-explode.

  • $delimiter is not a string for sl-explode.

sl-first 

@function sl-first ($list) { ... }

Description

Returns first element of $list.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to retrieve first item from

 List —

Returns

Any

Example

 sl-first(a b c)
 // a

 sl-first(a)
 // a

 sl-first(())
 // null

Throws

  • Cannot find first item of empty list.

Requires

  • sl-is-empty

Used by

  • sl-head

sl-insert-nth 

@function sl-insert-nth ($list, $index, $value) { ... }

Description

Adds $value at $index in $list.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to update

 List —
$index

index to add

 Number —
$value

value to add

 Any —

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-insert-nth(a b c, 2, z)
 // a z b c

 sl-insert-nth(a b c, 42, z)
 // a b c z

 
 sl-insert-nth(a b c, -42, z)
 // null

Throws

  • List index $index is not a number for sl-insert-nth.

  • List index $index must be a non-zero integer for sl-insert-nth.

Requires

  • sl-is-true

first list

Example

sl-loop 

@function sl-loop ($list, $value: 1) { ... }

Description

Shift indexes from $list of $value.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to update

 List —
$value

number of position between old and new indexes

 Number 1

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-loop(a b c)
 // c a b
 
 sl-loop(a b c, 2)
 // b c a

Throws

  • $value is not a number for loop.

Requires

  • sl-has-multiple-values

Used by

  • sl-shift-indexes

Author

Ana Tudor

sl-range 

@function sl-range ($n) { ... }

Description

Build a list of values from 1 through $n.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$n

maximum value

 Number —

Returns

List , number , null

Example

 sl-range(5)
 // 1 2 3 4 5

 sl-range(1)
 // 1

 sl-range(-42)
 // null

Throws

  • $n is not a number for sl-range.

  • $n is not unitless for sl-range.

  • $n is not greater than 0 for sl-range.

Used by

  • sl-to-map

sl-replace-nth

 List —

index to update

 Number —
$value

new value for index

 Any —

Returns

List , null

Example

sl-replace 

@function sl-replace ($list, $old, $value) { ... }

Description

Replaces $old by $new in $list.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to update

 List —
$old

value to replace

 Any —
$value

new value for $old

 Any —

Returns

List

Example

 sl-replace(a b c, b, z)
 // a z c

 sl-replace(a b c, y, z)
 // a b c

Requires

  • sl-is-true
  • sl-purge
  • sl-to-list

Used by

  • sl-remove

sl-slice 

@function sl-slice ($list, $start: 1, $end: length($list) { ... }

Description

Slices $list between $start and $end.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to slice

 List —
$start

start index

 Number 1
$end

) - end index

 Number length($list

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-slice(a b c d e, 2, 4)
 // b c d

 sl-slice(a b c d e, 2, 2)
 // b

 sl-slice(a b c d e, 4, 2)
 // null

 sl-slice(a b c d e, -1, 6)
 // null

Throws

  • List indexes $start and $end must be numbers for sl-slice.

  • Start index has to be lesser than or equals to the end index for sl-slice.

  • List indexes must be non-zero integers for sl-slice.

  • Start index has to be lesser than or equal to list length for sl-slice.

  • End index has to be lesser than or equal to list length for sl-slice.

Used by

  • sl-tail

sl-some 

@function sl-some ($list, $function, $args...) { ... }

Description

Tests whether some items from $list pass the test implemented by $function.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to run test against

 List —
$function

function to run against every item from list

 String —
$args

extra arguments to pass to the function

 Arglist —

Returns

Bool

Example

 sl-some(1 2 3, unitless)
 // true

 sl-some(1 2 3px, unitless)
 // true

 sl-some(1px 2px 3px, unitless)
 // false

sl-sort 

@function sl-sort ($list, $order) { ... }

Description

Sorts values of $list using quick-sort algorithm using $order.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to sort

 List —
$order

order to respect

 List —

Returns

List

Example

 sl-sort(b a c)
 // a b c

 sl-sort(3 5 1)
 // 1 3 5

Requires

  • sl-str-compare
  • sl-has-multiple-values
  • sl-to-list

Used by

  • sl-order

sl-sum 

@function sl-sum ($list, $force: false) { ... }

Description

Sums up all numeric values in $list, stripping unit if $force set to true.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list

 List —
$force

enable/disable parseInt

 Bool false

Returns

Number

Example

 sl-sum(1 2 3)
 // 6

 sl-sum(a b 1)
 null

 sl-sum(1 2 3px, true)
 // 6

Throws

  • All items from list are not numbers for sl-sum.

Requires

  • sl-every
  • sl-is-number

sl-to-map 

@function sl-to-map ($list) { ... }

Description

Casts $list into a map, using indexes as keys (starting with $start).
Useful for iterating through a list with an index variable.
e.g. @each $index, $value in to-map($list)

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to turn into map

 List —

Returns

Map , null

Example

 sl-to-map(a b c)
 // 1 a, 2 b, 3 c

Throws

  • List cannot be empty for sl-to-map.

Requires

  • sl-range
  • sl-is-empty

Used by

  • sl-enumerate
  • sl-mapify
  • sl-walk

Authors

Andrey "Lolmaus" Mikhaylov

Chris Eppstein

sl-to-string 

@function sl-to-string ($list, $glue: '') { ... }

Description

Joins all elements of $list with $glue.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to cast

 List —
$glue

value to use as a join string

 String ''

Returns

String

Example

 sl-to-string(a b c)
 // abc

 sl-to-string(a b c, '-')
 // a-b-c

Requires

  • sl-has-multiple-values
  • sl-last

Used by

  • sl-stringify

sl-walk 

@function sl-walk ($list, $function, $args...) { ... }

Description

Apply $function to every item from $list passing $args as parameters.

Parameters

Name Description Type Default value
$list

list to update

 List —
$function

function to call on each value

 String —
$args

optional function arguments

 Arglist —

Returns

List , null

Example

 sl-walk(a b c, to-upper-case)
 // A B C

Throws

  • There is no $function function for sl-walk.

Requires

  • sl-to-map
  • sl-to-list
